content.text: The GSE Profession team are launching an exciting new professional recognition offer! By forging partnerships with a variety of professional bodies across science and engineering, GSE members can now access more opportunities for their career development. The GSE Profession team is incredibly passionate about finding ways to recognise the inspiring and highly renowned skillset and experience of GSE members.

This professional recognition offer will provide you with: information about what becoming professionally recognised means, the benefits to individuals and departments, how you go about applying, and how we can support you in tracking the skills needed to become registered, chartered or continue your professional development. Read our earlier blog to see the list of our current partner institutions.

To receive information on the support outlined in steps 2-4, please email gse@go-science.gov.uk and we will send you our full support package (available from late-September 2021).

Please see below some FAQs on the GSE professional recognition offer. Many of these questions will be answered through introductory events in our GSE Recognition Week (13th – 20th September 2021) which we encourage you to attend to find out more!

We are also looking into developing a bank of mentors to support GSE members through their application process. Some professional organisations provide coaching and mentorship, but having someone within government or even within your department can be of immense help in understanding what evidence you can use for your applications.

If you are already professionally recognised with any professional institute/body and would be willing to mentor someone in your department new to this process, please let us know by emailing gse@go-science.gov.uk.
